required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Hysteroscopy With Fundus Uterus Scratching Incision VS Office Hysteroscopy Before ET With Donor Eggs
clinical_study.official_title: Oocyte Recipients Before Embryo Transfer Randomization: Hysteroscopy With Fundus Uterus Scratching VS Hysteroscopy Without Fundus Uterus Scratching

collaborator.agency: 3rd Department of Obstetrics and Gynaecology, Aristotle University of Thessaloniki

brief_summary.textblock: A prospective randomised control trial of the impact of the fundus edometrial incision during hysteroscopy in oocyte recipients.

detailed_description.textblock:
A prospective randomised control trial of the impact of the fundus edometrial incision during hysteroscopy in women without intrauterine pathology which is likely to have an adverse effect on reproductive outcomes. The study populations will be constituted by oocyte recipients.
Study group: Hysteroscopy with fundus endometrial incision Control group: Office Hysteroscopy without any endometrial injury

primary_outcome.time_frame: 6 weeks to 42 weeks after embryo transfer]
6 weeks to 42 weeks after embryo transfer]

arm_group.description: Women following IVF treatment with donor oocytes who underwent during hysteroscopy fundus endometrial scratching by incision, before embryo transfer.
Women following IVF treatment with donor oocytes who underwent office hysteroscopy without fundus endometrial scratching by incision, before embryo transfer.

intervention.intervention_name: Uterine fundus endometrial incision during hysteroscopy
intervention.description: Uterine fundus endometrial scratching during hysteroscopy by incision

study_pop.textblock: Women 30-50 years old with infertility undergoing IVF treatment with donor oocytes. 1-2 blastocysts are transferred per cycle with endometrium preparation with Hormone Replacement Therapy.The study population has underwent hysteroscopy with fundus endometrial incision before the embryo transfer.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- oocyte acceptors
- age 30-50
- embryo transfer with Hormone Replacement Therapy
- embryo transfer within 6 months of hysteroscopy
Exclusion Criteria:
- previous uterine pathology
- sperm sample <1mil/ml
- leiomyoma
- septate uterus

overall_official.affiliation: Assisting Nature, 3rd Department of Obstetrics and Gynaecology, Aristotle University of Thessaloniki
